intro: Blumea fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered blumea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia and the Pacific. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows as an erect herb or shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its small yellow flowers are arranged in dense clusters, and the plant produces oval, woody fruits that contain several seeds. Blumea fasciculata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
